meanings.definition: A person or thing that rings bells.
meanings.sent1: The church hired a ringer to play the bells every Sunday morning.
meanings.sent2: The old town hall has a beautiful ringer that chimes every hour.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat became a ringer, pawing at the bell to wake everyone up.
meanings.sent4: The ringer in the clock tower sang out, marking the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The ringer's melody filled the air, bringing a sense of peace to the village.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is exceptionally good or skillful.
meanings.sent1: She's a real ringer when it comes to solving puzzles quickly.
meanings.sent2: The chef at the restaurant is a true ringer in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The young magician turned out to be a surprising ringer at card tricks.
meanings.sent4: His guitar skills were so impressive, he was considered a ringer in the band.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was a ringer, capturing the beauty of the landscape perfectly.

meanings.definition: A person who substitutes for another in a competition or game.
meanings.sent1: The coach decided to bring in a ringer to replace the injured player.
meanings.sent2: The team's secret weapon was their ringer, who turned the game around.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected ringer on the opposing team caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the ringer of the group, always stepping in when needed.
meanings.sent5: The ringer's last-minute goal secured the victory for the underdog team.
